codeSystems.title: v2 table 0360, Version 2.7

codeSystems.name: ActCode
codeSystems.title: v3 Code System ActCode
codeSystems.description:
A code specifying the particular kind of Act that the Act-instance represents within its class.  Constraints:
The kind of Act (e.g. physical examination, serum potassium, inpatient encounter, charge financial transaction, etc.) is specified with a code from one of several, typically external, coding systems.  The coding system will depend on the class of Act, such as LOINC for observations, etc. Conceptually, the Act.code must be a specialization of the Act.classCode. This is why the structure of ActClass domain should be reflected in the superstructure of the ActCode domain and then individual codes or externally referenced vocabularies subordinated under these domains that reflect the ActClass structure. Act.classCode and Act.code are not modifiers of each other but the Act.code concept should really imply the Act.classCode concept. For a negative example, it is not appropriate to use an Act.code "potassium" together with and Act.classCode for "laboratory observation" to somehow mean "potassium laboratory observation" and then use the same Act.code for "potassium" together with Act.classCode for "medication" to mean "substitution of potassium". This mutually modifying use of Act.code and Act.classCode is not permitted.

codeSystems.name: ActEncounterCode
codeSystems.title: ActEncounterCode
codeSystems.description: Domain provides codes that qualify the ActEncounterClass (ENC)

codeSystems.name: ActPriority
codeSystems.title: ActPriority
codeSystems.description:
A code or set of codes (e.g., for routine, emergency,) specifying the urgency under which the Act happened, can happen, is happening, is intended to happen, or is requested/demanded to happen.

*Discussion:* This attribute is used in orders to indicate the ordered priority, and in event documentation it indicates the actual priority used to perform the act. In definition mood it indicates the available priorities.

codeSystems.name: ActSubstanceAdminSubstitutionCode
codeSystems.title: ActSubstanceAdminSubstitutionCode
codeSystems.description: ***No description***

codeSystems.name: LanguageAbilityMode

codeSystems.description:
A value representing the method of expression of the language.

*Example:*Expressed spoken, expressed written, expressed signed, received spoken, received written, received signed.

codeSystems.name: LanguageAbilityProficiency
codeSystems.title: LanguageAbilityProficiency
codeSystems.description:
A value representing the level of proficiency in a language.

*Example:*Excellent, good, fair, poor.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreAllergyCode
codeSystems.title: UK Core Allergy Code
codeSystems.description: A set of codes from the following dm+d (dictionary of medicines and devices) concept classes that define a medication or medication ingredient that the patient has an allergy or intolerance to:  - VTM – Virtual Therapeutic Moiety  - VMP – Virtual Medicinal Product  - AMP – Actual Medicinal Product  - Ingredient  A set of codes from the SNOMED CT UK coding system that:    - identify a substance or pharmaceutical or biologic product that the patient has an allergy or intolerance to   - state that the patient has no known allergy or does not have a specific allergy   - provide a degrade of information about a drug or non-drug allergy   Where no dm+d or SNOMED CT coded information is available, a specific code from the nullFlavor Code System can be used instead to indicate this.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreAllergyManifestation
codeSystems.title: UK Core Allergy Manifestation
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that describe how a patient's allergy was manifested. Selected from the 'Health issues' simple reference set of the SNOMED CT UK coding system. Alternatively provides a code indicating a degrade of information about a clinical record entry. Where no SNOMED CT coded information is available, a specific code from the nullFlavor Code System can be used instead to indicate this.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreAllergySubstance
codeSystems.title: UK Core Allergy Substance
codeSystems.description: A set of codes from the following dm+d (dictionary of medicines and devices) concept classes that define a medication or medication ingredient that the patient has an allergy or intolerance to:    - VTM – Virtual Therapeutic Moiety  - VMP – Virtual Medicinal Product  - AMP – Actual Medicinal Product  - Ingredient   A set of codes from the SNOMED CT UK coding system that:    - identify a substance or pharmaceutical or biologic product that the patient has an allergy or intolerance to   - provide a degrade of information about a drug or non-drug allergy    Where no dm+d or SNOMED CT coded information is available, a specific code from the nullFlavor Code System can be used instead to indicate this.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreBodySite
codeSystems.title: UK Core Body Site
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that define an anatomical or acquired body structure site. Selected from the SNOMED CT UK coding system.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreCareSettingType
codeSystems.title: UK Core Care Setting Type
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that describe a type of care setting. Selected from the 'Services' simple reference set of the SNOMED CT UK coding system.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreCompositionCategory
codeSystems.title: UK Core Composition Category
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that categorise the type of composition.  Selected from the SNOMED CT UK coding system.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreCompositionSectionCode
codeSystems.title: UK Core Composition Section Code
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that define standard record headings for the exchange of data.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreConditionCategory
codeSystems.title: UK Core Condition Category
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that define the category of a condition.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreConditionCode
codeSystems.title: UK Core Condition Code
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that define a clinical finding or a finding with explicit context or an event. Selected from the SNOMED CT UK coding system.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreDischargeDestination
codeSystems.title: UK Core Discharge Destination
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that define where a patient is sent on completion of a hospital provider spell, or a note that the patient died or was a still birth.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreDocumentType
codeSystems.title: UK Core Document Type
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that describe a type of document. Selected from the 'Record composition type' simple reference set of the SNOMED CT UK coding system.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreEncounterLocationType
codeSystems.title: UK Core Encounter Location Type
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that define the physical type of location where an encounter takes place.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreEncounterType
codeSystems.title: UK Core Encounter Type
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that describe an encounter between a care professional and the patient (or patient's record).  Selected from codes from the SNOMED CT UK coding system that define:  - an indirect encounter  - the establishment seen in  -  the site of the encounter.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreMedicationCode
codeSystems.title: UK Core Medication Code
codeSystems.description: A set of codes from the following dm+d (dictionary of medicines and devices) concept classes that define a medication:   - VTM – Virtual Therapeutic Moiety  - VMP – Virtual Medicinal Product  - AMP – Actual Medicinal Product  - VMPP – Virtual Medicinal Product Pack  - AMPP – Actual Medicinal Product Pack  A Clinical trial medication code. Selected from the SNOMED CT UK coding system.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreMedicationDosageMethod
codeSystems.title: UK Core Medication Dosage Method
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that define a medication dosage method. Selected from the 'ePrescribing method' simple reference set of the SNOMED CT UK coding system.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreMedicationForm
codeSystems.title: UK Core Medication Form
codeSystems.description: A set of codes from that define a medication dose form. Selected from the 'NHS dm+d (dictionary of medicines and devices) dose form' simple reference set of the SNOMED CT UK coding system.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreMedicationRequestCategory

codeSystems.description: A set of codes to define a category for a medication request.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreMedicationRequestCourseOfTherapy
codeSystems.title: UK Core Medication Request Course Of Therapy
codeSystems.description: A set of codes to define a course of therapy for a medication request.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreMedicationStatementCategory
codeSystems.title: UK Core Medication Statement Category
codeSystems.description: A set of codes to define a category for a medication statement.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreOrganizationType
codeSystems.title: UK Core Organization Type
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that can be used to indicate a type of organization.

codeSystems.name: UKCorePersonMaritalStatusCode
codeSystems.title: UK Core Person Marital Status Code

codeSystems.name: UKCorePersonRelationshipType
codeSystems.title: UK Core Person Relationship Type

codeSystems.name: UKCorePracticeSettingCode
codeSystems.title: UK Core Practice Setting Code
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that define the clinical specialty of the clinician or provider who interacted with, treated, or provided a service to/for the patient.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreSourceOfAdmission
codeSystems.title: UK Core Source Of Admission
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that define the source of admission to a hospital provider spell or a nursing episode when the patient is in a hospital site or a care home.

codeSystems.name: UKCoreSubstanceOrProductAdministrationRoute
codeSystems.title: UK Core Substance Or Product Administration Route
codeSystems.description: A set of codes that describe the route:   - with which a medication was or should be administered to a patient;  - by which a vaccine product is taken into the body;  - by which a patient was exposed to a substance or product causing an allergy or intolerance.  Selected from the 'ePrescribing route of administration' simple reference set of the SNOMED CT UK coding system.
